results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Hispanic-Americans;Discrimination;Black People;United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2016;United States Economy;Minorities;Immigration and Emigration;Trump, Donald J;Texas;Florida
results.title: The ‘Sleeping Giant’ That May Decide the Midterms
results.abstract: The choices made by Latino voters will be crucial to the outcome in a disproportionate share of Senate battleground states and key House races.

media.caption: Monica De La Cruz, the Republican candidate in Texas’ 15th Congressional District, at a rally in McAllen, Texas.
media.copyright: Verónica G. Cárdenas for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Putin, Vladimir V;Ukraine;Russia;Kyiv (Ukraine);Crimea (Ukraine)
results.title: Putin Has Sent Us a Message, but Not the One He Meant To
results.abstract: Among Ukrainians, there is an almost palpable feeling that Russia is losing the war.

results.title: ‘Do these people actually think they’re getting any money?’ Jones denounces the verdict, and fund-raises.
results.abstract: Broadcasting in tandem with the court hearing, Alex Jones called the $965 million judgment against him a “joke,” and urged his viewers to send him hundreds of thousands of dollars to pay for an appeal.

media.caption: Alex Jones with private security guards after appearing at his Sandy Hook defamation trial last week.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Espionage and Intelligence Services;Crimea (Ukraine);Kerch Strait
results.byline: By Michael Schwirtz and John Ismay
results.title: Russia announces the arrests of eight people over the Crimea bridge blast.
results.abstract: Five are citizens of Russia, according to Russia’s domestic intelligence agency, the F.S.B., and the others are Ukrainian and Armenian.

media.caption: Smoke billowing from a fire on the Kerch Strait Bridge linking Crimea to Russia on Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: Baseball;Kay, Eric;Skaggs, Tyler (1991-2019);Los Angeles Angels of Anaheim
results.title: Angels Employee Sentenced to 22 Years in Prison Over Death of Pitcher
results.abstract: Eric Kay had been convicted in February of contributing to the death of the pitcher Tyler Skaggs by providing him with opioids.

media.caption: Eric Kay was a communications director for the Angels. Multiple players testified that he provided them with drugs.

results.adx_keywords: Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Tropical Storm Karl;Gulf of Mexico;Mexico;Yucatan Peninsula (Mexico);Veracruz (Mexico);Tabasco (Mexico)
results.title: Tropical Storm Karl Strengthens as Mexico Prepares for Landfall
results.abstract: The authorities in Mexico expected the storm to come ashore near Veracruz as a hurricane late Friday or early Saturday.

media.caption: Tropical Storm Karl formed on Tuesday west of the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico.

results.adx_keywords: Education (K-12);Private and Sectarian Schools;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Hasidism;Rosa, Betty A;Education Department (NYC);Education Department (NYS);Brooklyn (NYC);New York City;New York State
results.byline: By Eliza Shapiro and Brian M. Rosenthal
results.title: Hasidic School Is Breaking State Education Law, N.Y. Official Rules
results.abstract: Issued amid a lawsuit brought by a parent who left the community, the determination could signal challenges for scores of Hasidic Jewish schools.

media.caption: Yeshiva Mesivta Arugath Habosem, an all-boys Hasidic school in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, is not complying with a state education law requiring private schools to offer basic secular studies.

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Legal Profession;Classified Information and State Secrets;Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);United States Politics and Government;Project Democracy;Bobb, Christina;Trump, Donald J;Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Justice Department;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Homeland Security Department;One America News Network
results.byline: By Glenn Thrush, Maggie Haberman and Michael S. Schmidt
results.title: She Went Out on a Limb for Trump. Now She’s Under Justice Dept. Scrutiny.
results.abstract: Christina Bobb is a former Marine and a fervent believer that the 2020 election was stolen from Donald J. Trump. She went to work for him and quickly found herself enmeshed in an obstruction investigation.

media.caption: Christina Bobb, a former One America News Network anchor, was a late addition to former President Donald J. Trump’s legal team. She is now at the heart of the Justice Department’s criminal investigation into his handling of White House documents.
media.copyright: Megan Mendoza/The Republic, via USA Today Network

results.adx_keywords: Legal Profession;Ethics and Official Misconduct;Presidential Election of 2020;Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);United States Politics and Government;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Chesebro, Kenneth;Trump, Donald J;Lawyers Defending American Democracy;New York State
results.title: Lawyers Group Asks Court to Punish an Author of Trump Electors Scheme
results.abstract: An ethics complaint in New York against Kenneth Chesebro is the latest example of legal troubles for lawyers who helped Donald J. Trump try to overturn the 2020 election.

media.caption: Kenneth Chesebro wrote the earliest known memo putting forward a proposal for having a slate of fake electors to help President Donald J. Trump overturn the election.
media.copyright: Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Luggage and Packing;Bluetooth Wireless Technology;Batteries;Apple Inc;Deutsche Lufthansa AG;Federal Aviation Administration;International Air Transport Assn;Tile Inc;International Civil Aviation Organization;Germany;United States;Europe
results.title: Lufthansa Says Passengers Can’t Use Apple AirTags to Track Checked Bags
results.abstract: It appears to be the sole airline saying that international standards don’t allow passengers to use the Bluetooth devices in the cargo hold. Apple said that regulators allow their use for all baggage.

media.caption: An Apple AirTag, designed to track and find personal belongings. It uses a standard watch battery and Bluetooth Low Energy radio technology to share its location.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Endorsements;Elections, Senate;Laxalt, Adam;Masto, Catherine Cortez;Republican Party;Arizona
results.title: Family of Republican Senate Candidate in Nevada Endorses His Opponent
results.abstract: The Republican candidate, Adam Laxalt, built his political career on his family name. Some of his relatives are now hoping they can put an end to that career.

media.caption: Adam Laxalt, a Republican running for Senate in Nevada, arriving at a rally with former President Donald J. Trump on Saturday.
media.copyright: Bridget Bennett for The New York Times

results.title: Here’s what Russia’s attacks may indicate about its weapons stockpile.
results.abstract: Russia’s assault on Ukraine on Monday raised questions about the capacity of Moscow’s forces to carry out President Vladimir V. Putin’s military calculations.

media.caption: A Russian rocket serves as a reminder of the relentless bombardment of Kharkiv, Ukraine.
media.copyright: Ivor Prickett for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: United States International Relations;War and Armed Conflicts;Prisons and Prisoners;Political Prisoners;Decisions and Verdicts;Basketball;Griner, Brittney;Whelan, Paul N;Russia
results.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Michael Crowley
results.title: Brittney Griner Is Increasingly Anxious She May Not Be Freed, Lawyer Says
results.abstract: Facing nine years in prison in Russia, the U.S. basketball star is struggling emotionally and worried that a swap deal to release her may not materialize, according to one of her attorneys.

media.caption: Brittney Griner at a court outside Moscow in August. The United States has said that her detention and trial were politically motivated.

results.adx_keywords: City Councils;Race and Ethnicity;Martinez, Nury;Los Angeles (Calif)
results.byline: By Jill Cowan and Shawn Hubler
results.title: Los Angeles City Councilwoman Resigns Amid Uproar Over Racist Remarks
results.abstract: The former Council president, Nury Martinez, faced calls from state leaders and President Biden to leave office after making racist remarks on a recording that emerged on Sunday.

media.caption: The former Los Angeles City Council president Nury Martinez during a news conference in Los Angeles last month. Ms. Martinez announced her resignation as a councilwoman on Wednesday.
media.copyright: Al Seib/Los Angeles Times via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Economic Conditions and Trends;Recession and Depression;Interest Rates;Banking and Financial Institutions;United States Economy;International Monetary Fund;World Bank
results.title: A Warning for the World Economy: ‘The Worst Is Yet to Come’
results.abstract: The International Monetary Fund lowered its growth outlook for 2023 and suggested that interest rate increases could spur a harsh global recession.

media.caption: “The risks are accumulating,” said Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas, the International Monetary Fund’s chief economist, right.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Hurricane Sandy (2012);Federal Aid (US);Hurricane Ian (2022);Christie, Christopher J;DeSantis, Ron;Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.title: Christie, Recalling Sandy, Questions DeSantis’s Views on Hurricane Aid
results.abstract: Mr. Christie noted that Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida sought help after Hurricane Ian despite having voted against aid for Hurricane Sandy in 2013.

media.caption: Chris Christie, the former governor of New Jersey, questioned whether Gov. Ron DeSantis of Florida would stick to the principles he held as a congressman regarding hurricane aid.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.title: Teenagers Are Telling Us That Something Is Wrong With America
results.abstract: Adolescents live at the fault lines of a culture, exposing our weak spots.

results.title: Pressure Grows on the West to Speed Air-Defense Systems to Ukraine

results.abstract: She was a Hollywood and Broadway sensation, but she captured the biggest audience of her career as the TV sleuth Jessica Fletcher.

results.title: Netflix Nears Deal to Build Huge Production Complex on Jersey Shore
results.abstract: The company was the top bidder for land occupied by a former Army base.

media.caption: Gov. Phil Murphy said New Jersey was “thrilled” that Netflix was chosen to take over nearly 300 acres of the Fort Monmouth site.
